main event: An inspector observed a low light in the sky while on patrol at Station 103 in Los Alamos, NM on 2 March 1949.
interesting points: The observation was made at approximately 0010 hours.,The object traveled very fast, covering half of his field of view in two seconds.,It was self-luminous with a dim and constant intensity.,The object moved in a horizontal plane from north to south.,The sighting lasted for about two seconds before it disappeared behind trees.
sighted object: a low light in the sky
witness description: an inspector with the Atomic Energy Security Services
